Enable Google Voice Typing (Gboard) â€” Switch Keyboards, Use Offline & Send Voice Messages

A clear, AdSense-friendly guide to get Google Voice Typing (speech-to-text) working on Android: enable it, switch back to the keyboard when needed, install offline language packs, and use the mic to send messages.

Contents
  1. Quick overview
  2. How to enable Google Voice Typing
  3. Switch from voice typing back to keyboard
  4. Use Google Voice Typing offline (install language pack)
  5. Send a message by voice
  6. Troubleshooting & tips

Quick overview

Google Voice Typing is built into Gboard (Google Keyboard) and provides fast speech-to-text input across apps. On most phones itâ€™s enabled by default, but if you canâ€™t see a mic icon on the keyboard, follow the steps below to enable it and to run it offline.

How to enable Google Voice Typing

  1. Open Settings on your phone.
  2. Go to Language & input (or System > Languages & input on some phones).
  3. Select Virtual keyboard (or On-screen keyboard), then tap Gboard (Google Keyboard).
  4. Tap Voice typing and enable Use voice typing (or toggle Google Voice Typing).
  5. Return to any text field and open the keyboard â€” the mic icon should now appear. Tap the mic to start speaking.

If your keyboard language doesnâ€™t support voice input, switch the keyboard language to a supported language (e.g., English, Malayalam, etc.).

How to switch from Google Voice Typing back to a keyboard

If Google Voice Typing is active and you want to type normally, switch keyboards quickly:

  1. When the keyboard appears, look for the keyboard icon (usually near the bottom-right) or long-press the spacebar.
  2. Select your preferred keyboard (Gboard, Samsung Keyboard, SwiftKey, etc.).
  3. If the mic is showing and you donâ€™t want it, open Settings > Languages & input > Virtual keyboard and disable Google Voice Typing or toggle off the mic in Gboard settings.

Switching keyboards is fast â€” do it when voice results are inaccurate or when privacy is a concern.

Use Google Voice Typing offline (install offline speech package)

By default Google processes speech online. To use voice typing without an internet connection, download offline speech files:

  1. Open Settings > Google > Settings for Google apps > Search, Assistant & Voice > Voice.
  2. Tap Offline speech recognition > All and select the language you want (English, Malayalam, etc.).
  3. Tap the language to download the offline recognition package. Wait for the download to complete (use Wiâ€‘Fi to save data).
  4. Once installed, return to Gboard > Voice typing â€” offline speech recognition will be available automatically.

Offline packs are compact but make sure you have enough storage before downloading.

How to send a message by voice

  1. Open any messaging app (SMS, WhatsApp, Messenger) and tap the text field to open the keyboard.
  2. Tap the microphone icon on the keyboard and speak your message clearly. The text appears as you speak.
  3. Review the transcribed text, edit if needed, then send.

You can enable profanity filtering or punctuation insertion in Gboard settings if you prefer automated punctuation or censorship of offensive words.

Troubleshooting & tips

  • No mic icon? Ensure Gboard is set as the default keyboard: Settings > Languages & input > Virtual keyboard > Manage keyboards.
  • Poor recognition? Download the offline language pack, speak clearly, or try a different supported language variant (e.g., English (US) vs English (UK)).
  • Privacy: Voice input may be sent to Google servers unless offline mode and local processing are used. Review Google app permissions.
  • Battery/data: Online voice recognition consumes data; use Wiâ€‘Fi for downloads and offline packs to save mobile data.

entry.title: How to Fix Blue Screen Errors in Windows 11
entry.content:
The Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) in Windows 11 is frustrating because it hits without warning and gives you only a cryptic stop code before shutting everything down. The truth is, most users donâ€™t understand these codes because theyâ€™re not written in plain language. Until Microsoft improves how clearly BSOD messages explain the root cause, we have to depend on smart troubleshooting and step-by-step methods to get the system back on track.

Blue Screen Error in Windows 11

The good news? Most BSOD errors are fixable at home. Whether the issue comes from faulty updates, incompatible drivers, or corrupted system files, this guide walks you through everything you need to fix the problem and prevent future crashes.

Common Causes of Blue Screen Errors in Windows 11

  • Faulty or incomplete Windows updates
  • Hardware incompatibility or failing hardware components
  • Corrupted drivers or software conflicts
  • Malware or virus attacks disrupting system processes

Understanding the cause helps you choose the right solution. In most cases, troubleshooting is straightforward when handled step by step.

1. Remove Unnecessary Devices

External devices can sometimes trigger BSOD errors, especially if the hardware is old, incompatible, or faulty. Many users overlook this simple step, but it fixes more issues than you might expect.

What to Disconnect:

  • USB flash drives
  • External hard disks
  • Printers or scanners
  • Webcams
  • Game controllers
  • Bluetooth dongles

After unplugging them, restart your PC. If the blue screen doesnâ€™t return, reconnect devices one by one to identify the culprit.

2. Use System Restore

System Restore is one of Windows 11â€™s most powerful recovery tools. It allows you to take the system back to a point when everything was working smoothly, without affecting personal files. However, apps and drivers installed after the restore point will be removed.

How System Restore Helps

BSOD errors often begin after:

  • A driver update
  • A system update
  • Software installation
  • Registry modification

Rolling back to a previous healthy state can undo the problem instantly.

Steps to Use System Restore

  • Open Settings and go to System.
  • Select Recovery.
  • Click Advanced startup > Restart Now.
  • Go to Troubleshoot > Advanced Options > System Restore.
  • Choose a restore point from the list and confirm.

This process may take several minutes. Once completed, Windows restarts and typically resumes normal operation if a system-level issue was causing the crash.

3. Update or Roll Back Windows Updates

A buggy update can break the system and lead to blue screens. Windows 11 updates are usually reliable, but sometimes new patches conflict with certain hardware or drivers.

To Roll Back a Problematic Update:

  • Go to Settings > Windows Update.
  • Click Update history.
  • Select Uninstall updates.

If the BSOD began right after an update, uninstalling it often resolves the problem instantly.

To Install Pending Updates:

  • Go to Windows Update.
  • Click Check for updates.

Security patches and driver fixes may eliminate known issues causing system failures.

4. Update Drivers

Outdated or corrupted drivers are one of the top reasons for BSOD errors. Drivers act as the link between hardware and Windows, so when they malfunction, the entire system can crash.

Steps to Update Drivers:

  • Right-click the Start Menu and open Device Manager.
  • Expand categories such as Display adapters, Network adapters, and Storage controllers.
  • Right-click the hardware and choose Update driver.

You can also visit the manufacturerâ€™s website for the latest certified drivers, especially for graphics cards.

5. Scan for Malware

Viruses can corrupt system files, modify registry entries, and interrupt background servicesâ€”all of which can cause blue screen errors.

How to Scan for Malware:

  • Open Windows Security.
  • Click Virus & threat protection.
  • Select Full Scan.

If the infection is severe, consider using offline scanning or a trusted third-party antivirus.

6. Repair Corrupted System Files

Windows may crash if essential system files become corrupted. The System File Checker (SFC) and DISM tools are built-in repair utilities that restore these files to working condition.

Run SFC:

sfc /scannow

Run DISM:

dism /online /cleanup-image /restorehealth

Both commands must be run in Command Prompt (Admin).

7. Reset Your PC (Last Resort)

If nothing else works, resetting Windows is the strongest method to wipe out deep-level issues. It reinstalls Windows while giving you the option to keep or remove personal files.

Steps to Reset Your PC:

  • Open Settings.
  • Go to System > Recovery.
  • Click Reset this PC.
  • Choose Keep my files or Remove everything.

Important: Resetting removes apps and clears the C:\ drive (Desktop, Documents, Downloads). Back up your data before proceeding.

Conclusion

Blue screen errors can feel intimidating, but theyâ€™re often caused by solvable problems like faulty updates, outdated drivers, or corrupted files. Start with simple fixesâ€”disconnect peripherals, run System Restore, and update your system. Only move to advanced steps like SFC/DISM scans or a full PC reset if the issue continues.

With the right troubleshooting approach and regular maintenance, you can prevent future BSOD issues and keep Windows 11 running smoothly.

entry.title: How to Recover Deleted Files on Windows 10/11

File recovery on a Windows computer is time-dependent. This means that you are on the clock once you notice your deletion action. The recovery techniques below are some of the top methods that guarantee file recovery on your Windows machine.

How to restore files from your trash:

  • Open the Trash.
  • Locate the file you wish to restore and click.
  • You can also drag and drop the file to a new location if this is what you would prefer.

Recover Deleted Files in Windows 10 Without Third-Party Software

Itâ€™s possible that your data still physically resides on the drive but one thing or another is preventing it from showing up. The first option weâ€™re going to start with involves using CMD to (1) fix any file system issues that have caused the files to become temporarily lost, and (2) unhide any data that may have been hidden by a bug or virus.

Some Advice

  • Act quickly: The sooner you try to recover your files, the better your chances of getting them back before theyâ€™re overwritten.
  • Save recovered files on a different drive: This reduces the risk of overwriting the very data youâ€™re trying to retrieve.
  • Consider regular backups: If youâ€™ve been putting off setting up a backup system, let this be your wake-up call!

Recover deleted files from the Recycle Bin 

If you simply deleted files by moving them to the Recycle Bin and didn't execute the "Empty Recycle Bin" operation, you can restore deleted files with ease.

  • Step 1: Open the Recycle bin.
  • Step 2: Locate the file you want to recover.
  • Step 3: Right-click on the file and select "Restore" from the context menu.

  • Restore files in Windows Recycle Bin 


If you have emptied the Recycle Bin, please go to solution 2 and recover deleted files.

How to recover files on Windows 11 after an upgrade?

This section focuses specifically on five methods for recovering files after upgrading to Windows 11. These include:

  • Dealing with account issues (you were signed in with a temporary profile or the admin account was disabled)
  • Troubleshooting Windows Search to find files that were hidden or relocated
  •  Restoring files from native backup utilities
  • Rolling back to the previous Windows version

To restore lost files with Recycle Bin on Windows 11 and 10:

  1. Find the waste bin on your desktop or type Recycle Bin in the Windows search box.
  2. Double-click the icon or option to open the system folder.
  3. Click the Restore all items or Restore the selected items button in the menu at the top of the screen.A screenshot of the Recycle Bin in Windows 11.A screenshot of the Recycle Bin in Windows 10.
  4. The feature will restore the data and return files to their original location.

Note: Since Windows 10, the Recycle Bin retains deleted files until they occupy a certain percentage of the partition. By default, the number is between 5% and 10% of total space, but you can change it in your settings. Users can also enable Storage Sense within Windowsâ€™ Settings to empty the Recycle Bin after a given period.

Find deleted files through the File History feature

This Windows built-in feature will automatically back up data from your PCâ€™s Libraries, Favorites, and Desktop.

  • Step 1. Hit the Start button and type Control Panel to launch this program.
  • Step 2. Go to System and Security > File History, and choose the Restore personal files option.
  • Step 3. When you find the target file, click the green button at the bottom to restore it.

This method only works when you already have a backup copy in a specific location.

How to Fix Windows 10 & Windows 11 Black Screen of Death (Complete Step-by-Step Guide)

Windows cognoscenti recognize that there are two major types of black screen problems affecting both Windows 10 and Windows 11 systems. The first type is the most frightening one â€” a completely black screen. No cursor, no error message, no Windows logo. Just a dark display. Zip. Zero. Nada.

This issue is commonly referred to as the Black Screen of Death (BSOD), and it often appears after a Windows update, driver installation, graphics issue, overheating, or hardware malfunction. While it looks serious, in most cases, your data is safe and the issue can be fixed without reinstalling Windows.

Best Fix for Windows 11 Black Screen After Update

1. What Is the Windows Black Screen of Death?

The Windows Black Screen of Death is a critical display issue where the operating system is running, but nothing appears on the screen. Unlike the Blue Screen of Death, the system may still be active in the background.

This problem usually occurs:

  • After a Windows update
  • After installing or updating graphics drivers
  • Due to overheating or hardware failure
  • When display output switches to the wrong monitor

2. Common Causes of Black Screen in Windows 10 & 11

  • Corrupted or incompatible graphics drivers
  • Loose or faulty display cables
  • Overheating CPU or GPU
  • Windows update bugs
  • Power supply issues
  • Incorrect display configuration

3. Check If Your PC Is Actually Powered On

Sometimes Windows shuts down improperly, making it look like a black screen issue when the PC is simply powered off.

  • Check keyboard lights (Caps Lock / Num Lock)
  • Listen for fan or hard drive noise
  • Press the power button once (do not hold)

4. Repair a Black Screen of Death in Safe Mode

Safe Mode loads Windows with minimal drivers, making it ideal for fixing black screen issues caused by drivers or software.

How to Enter Safe Mode

  • Restart your PC
  • Press F8 or Shift + F8 repeatedly

If that doesnâ€™t work:

  • Force shutdown during Windows loading
  • Repeat 3 times
  • Windows will automatically boot into recovery mode

5. Fix Black Screen Caused by Graphics Drivers

Once in Safe Mode:

  • Open Device Manager
  • Expand Display adapters
  • Right-click your GPU
  • Select Uninstall device
  • Restart Windows normally

6. Fix Display Connection Issues

For desktop users, loose cables are a very common cause.

  • Disconnect monitor power cable
  • Disconnect HDMI / DisplayPort / VGA cable
  • Reconnect firmly
  • Try a different port or cable if available

7. Reset the Graphics Driver (Instant Fix)

This shortcut reloads the graphics driver instantly. 

Windows + Ctrl + Shift + B

8. Fix Black Screen on Virtual Machines

  • Change display device from virtio-ramfb-gl to virtio-gpu-gl-pci
  • Eject Windows installer ISO
  • Eject Spice Tools ISO
  • Restart the VM
  • Reinstall guest tools

9. Clean Your PC to Prevent Overheating

Overheating can trigger emergency shutdowns, resulting in a black screen.

  • Clean CPU fan
  • Clean GPU fan
  • Remove dust from RAM and PSU
  • Ensure proper airflow

10. Force Restart Your PC

  • Hold power button for 10 seconds
  • Unplug all accessories
  • Wait 30 seconds
  • Turn PC back on

11. Advanced Display Detection Methods

Windows may lose connection to the display. 

Windows + Ctrl + Shift + B

On some devices:

  • Press Volume Up + Volume Down together
  • Repeat 3 times quickly

12. Preventing Black Screen Issues in the Future

  • Keep graphics drivers updated
  • Avoid beta Windows updates
  • Clean PC every 3â€“6 months
  • Use a quality power supply
  • Monitor system temperatures

Final Words

A black screen in Windows 10 or Windows 11 looks terrifying, but in most cases, itâ€™s caused by driver or display issues that are easy to fix. By following the steps in this guide, you can recover your system without data loss or reinstalling Windows.

If none of these methods work, hardware failure may be involved, and professional repair may be required.

This guide will help you understand what causes Windows 10 blue screen errors, how to read stop codes, andâ€”most importantlyâ€”how to fix BSOD problems step by step using safe and proven methods.

1. What Is the Blue Screen of Death?

The Blue Screen of Death is a critical error screen displayed when Windows detects a problem it cannot safely recover from. These errors are also called stop code errors.

When a BSOD occurs:

  • Windows immediately stops all operations
  • A stop code is displayed
  • A memory dump (minidump) file is created
  • The system automatically restarts

The blue screen exists to protect your system from further damage.

2. Why Does Windows 10 Show a Blue Screen?

BSOD errors usually occur due to hardware or driver issues. Some of the most common causes include:

  • Faulty or outdated drivers
  • Corrupted system files
  • Failing hard drives or SSDs
  • Overheating CPU or GPU
  • RAM errors
  • Malware or corrupted updates

Understanding the cause makes troubleshooting much easier.

Fix Windows 10 Blue Screen Error (Step-by-Step)

4. Shut Down the PC After a BSOD

When a blue screen appears, Windows may freeze or restart automatically. If the system becomes unresponsive, press and hold the power button until the PC shuts down.

This forced shutdown is safe in this scenario because the system has already crashed.

Common issues after shutdown include:

  • Hard disk corruption or failing storage media
  • Firmware or BIOS configuration errors
  • Incomplete Windows updates

5. Disconnect All USB Devices Except Mouse and Keyboard

External devices can trigger BSODs due to incompatible or faulty drivers.

What to do:

If updating doesnâ€™t help, uninstall the driver and reboot.

8. Check Disk Errors and Free Storage

Low disk space or corrupted sectors can trigger system crashes.

  • Open This PC
  • Ensure at least 15% free space
  • Run chkdsk /f from Command Prompt

Disk health is critical for Windows stability.

9. Install the Latest Windows Updates

Microsoft regularly releases patches for known BSOD issues.

  • Go to Settings â†’ Update & Security
  • Click Check for updates
  • Install all available updates

Always restart after updating.

Windows 10 includes built-in diagnostic tools.

  1. Open Settings
  2. Go to Update & Security

Final Thoughts

The Windows 10 Blue Screen of Death looks scary, but itâ€™s often fixable with the right steps. By understanding the cause, checking drivers, updating Windows, and using built-in recovery tools, you can resolve most BSOD issues without reinstalling Windows.

Make regular maintenance a habit, and your PC will stay stable, fast, and reliable.

How to Fix Windows Update Not Working in Windows 10 & Windows 11 (Complete Troubleshooting Guide)

This section will guide you through different methods to fix the Windows Update not working issue. When Windows Update fails, it can prevent important security patches, feature improvements, and bug fixes from installing properly.

If the update process encounters unexpected errors or your system fails to boot after an update attempt, it may lead to data loss, system instability, or security risks. Therefore, before proceeding with advanced troubleshooting, it is always recommended to back up or restore all important files using a reliable data recovery or backup solution.

Table of Contents

  • 1. Why Windows Update Stops Working
  • 2. Windows Update Error Example
  • 3. Restart Your PC (Most Effective Fix)
  • 4. Run SFC and DISM to Repair System Files
  • 5. Pause and Resume Windows Updates
  • 6. Run Windows Update Troubleshooter
  • 7. Reset Windows Update Components Using Command Prompt

  • 9. Change Screen Resolution to Prevent Update Freezing
  • 10. How to Manually Upgrade a Windows Build
  • 11. Additional Tips to Prevent Windows Update Errors
  • Final Thoughts

1. Why Windows Update Stops Working

Windows Update is a critical service that keeps your operating system secure and up to date. However, several factors can cause updates to fail, freeze, or get stuck indefinitely.

Common reasons include:

  • Corrupted Windows system files
  • Damaged update cache
  • Insufficient disk space
  • Conflicting drivers or software
  • Interrupted internet connection
  • Hardware compatibility issues

Fortunately, most Windows update problems can be fixed without reinstalling the operating system.

2. Windows Update Error Example

How to Update Windows 10 Without Errors

3. Restart Your PC (Most Effective Fix)

Restarting Windows is often the simplest and most effective solution when Windows Update is not working.

Many updates require a reboot to modify locked system files and install core components. Restarting ensures:

  • Temporary system glitches are cleared
  • Pending update processes complete successfully
  • Drivers reload correctly

Always restart your system before trying more advanced fixes.

4. Run SFC and DISM to Repair System Files

Corrupted system files are a major reason behind Windows 10 update failed and Windows Update stuck issues.

Windows provides two powerful built-in tools to repair system integrity:

  • SFC (System File Checker)
  • DISM (Deployment Image Servicing and Management)

Steps to Run DISM and SFC

Step 1: Type Command Prompt in the search bar and open it as Administrator.

Step 2: Enter the following command and press Enter:

DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth

Step 3: Wait until you see the message: â€œThe operation completed successfully.â€

Step 4: Now type:

sfc /scannow

Step 5: When you see â€œVerification 100% completeâ€, type Exit and press Enter.

5. Pause and Resume Windows Updates

Pausing Windows Updates temporarily clears corrupted update files and forces Windows to download fresh update data.

Steps:

  • Open Settings â†’ Update & Security â†’ Windows Update
  • Click Advanced options
  • Enable Pause updates
  • Restart your computer
  • Disable Pause updates
  • Run Windows Update again

This method works surprisingly well for update download errors.

6. Run Windows Update Troubleshooter

Microsoft includes an automated troubleshooter that detects and fixes common update problems.

Open Settings â‡’ System â‡’ Troubleshoot â‡’ Other troubleshooters â‡’ Windows Update â‡’ Run

This tool resets update services, checks registry entries, and fixes permission issues.

7. Reset Windows Update Components Using Command Prompt

If Windows Update is still not working, manually reset update services.

Steps:

â‡’ Open Command Prompt as Administrator.

â‡’ Enter the following commands one by one:

  • net stop wuauserv
  • net stop cryptSvc
  • net stop bits
  • net stop msiserver
  • ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.old
  • ren C:\Windows\System32\catroot2 catroot2.old
  • net start wuauserv
  • net start cryptSvc
  • net start bits
  • net start msiserver

Restart your PC and try updating again.

8. Registry Edit (Advanced Users Only)

This method allows bypassing certain hardware checks such as CPU or TPM restrictions.

Warning: Incorrect registry edits can damage your system. Proceed only if you are experienced.

This option works only when running Setup from within Windowsâ€”not via bootable USB.

9. Change Screen Resolution to Prevent Update Freezing

Windows 11 may freeze or crash during updates due to hardware limitationsâ€”especially with 4K displays and low-end GPUs.

Reducing screen resolution can prevent update crashes:

  • Right-click Desktop â†’ Display settings
  • Lower resolution (e.g., 1920Ã—1080)
  • Apply changes

This is particularly helpful for systems freezing during feature updates.

10. How to Manually Upgrade a Windows Build

Windows Update also installs feature upgrades like Windows 11 23H2 â†’ 24H2.

If updates fail repeatedly, manually upgrade using the official Installation Assistant:

https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/windows11/

Run Windows11InstallationAssistant.exe and follow on-screen instructions.

11. Additional Tips to Prevent Windows Update Errors

  • Keep at least 20GB free disk space
  • Disable third-party antivirus temporarily
  • Update device drivers regularly
  • Use stable internet connections
  • Avoid forced shutdowns during updates

Final Thoughts

Windows Update errors can be frustrating, but they are rarely permanent. By following these step-by-step solutions, you can fix Windows Update not working issues in both Windows 10 and Windows 11 without reinstalling the OS.

Regular maintenance, proper backups, and timely updates will keep your system secure, stable, and running smoothly.

How On-Device AI Is Transforming Windows 11 Performance, Productivity, and User Experience

Artificial Intelligence is no longer a futuristic concept reserved for cloud servers and enterprise software. With Windows 11, Microsoft has brought on-device AI directly to personal computers, fundamentally changing how users interact with their systems. From smarter automation to improved responsiveness and enhanced privacy, AI is becoming a core part of the Windows experience.

In this in-depth guide, weâ€™ll explore how AI improves Windows 11 performance, how tools like Microsoft Copilot enhance productivity, and how you can make the most of these intelligent features while staying in control of your privacy.

1. What Is On-Device AI in Windows 11?

Frequency (Hz) Adjustment (dB)

Intel integrated graphics

Most likely your PC is low on RAM, storage is nearly full, or the GPU drivers are outdated. Close background apps and update drivers first.

No â€” clearing temporary cache removes only downloaded or temporary files. Your online/saved progress is maintained via the Rockstar/Social Club account or local save files.

How to Change Screen Resolution in Windows 10 (Complete Beginnerâ€™s Guide)

Changing screen resolution in Windows 10 is easy once you know where to look. Whether you want sharper text, better scaling, or to fix display issues, this step-by-step guide walks you through every method.

What Is Screen Resolution?

Screen resolution refers to the number of pixels displayed on your screen horizontally and vertically. Itâ€™s written in the format width Ã— height, such as 1920 Ã— 1080.

A higher resolution means more pixels, resulting in sharper images and clearer text. A lower resolution means fewer pixels, which can make everything appear larger but less sharp.

Windows 10 automatically selects a resolution that works best with your monitor, known as the recommended resolution. However, you may want to change it for performance, readability, or troubleshooting reasons.

Why You Might Need to Change Screen Resolution

  • Text or icons appear too small or too large
  • Blurry or stretched display
  • External monitor not displaying correctly
  • Games or apps require a specific resolution
  • Fixing display issues after driver updates

Whatever the reason, Windows 10 gives you several ways to adjust display resolution safely.

Quick Tips Before You Start

  • Always try the recommended resolution first
  • Windows will revert automatically if the screen becomes unusable
  • Resolution changes donâ€™t damage your monitor
  • You may need updated graphics drivers to see all options

Method 1: Change Screen Resolution Using Display Settings

This is the easiest and most common method to change screen resolution in Windows 10.

  1. Right-click on an empty area of the desktop
  2. Select Display settings
  3. Scroll down to the Display resolution section
  4. Click the drop-down menu
  5. Select your desired resolution

Windows will show a preview and ask whether you want to keep the new resolution.

  • Click Keep changes if it looks good
  • If you donâ€™t respond within 15 seconds, Windows will revert automatically

Method 2: Using Graphics Control Panel

Some systems provide quick access to graphics settings through a right-click menu.

  1. Right-click on the desktop
  2. Select Graphics Properties or Graphics Options
  3. Navigate to Display or Resolution
  4. Choose a new resolution and apply

This method depends on your graphics hardware and driver version.

Method 3: Using Graphics Driver Software

If your PC has a dedicated graphics card, you likely have manufacturer software installed.

Common tools include:

  • NVIDIA Control Panel
  • AMD Radeon Software
  • Intel Graphics Command Center
  1. Open the graphics software from Start or system tray
  2. Go to display or screen settings
  3. Select your preferred resolution
  4. Apply the changes

Understanding Recommended Resolution

The recommended resolution matches your monitorâ€™s native pixel layout.

Using non-native resolutions may cause:

  • Blurry text
  • Stretched images
  • Black borders

For best visual quality, always choose the resolution marked as (Recommended).

Troubleshooting Resolution Problems

  • Update your graphics drivers
  • Restart your PC after changes
  • Check monitor cable connections
  • Use correct refresh rate settings
  • Try Safe Mode if the screen goes blank

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Why canâ€™t I see higher resolutions?
A: Your graphics driver may be outdated or your monitor doesnâ€™t support them.

Q: Will changing resolution harm my PC?
A: No. Windows safely handles resolution changes.

Q: Why does everything look small at high resolution?
A: You may need to adjust Display Scaling instead of resolution.

Final Thoughts

Changing screen resolution in Windows 10 is a simple but powerful way to improve visual clarity, fix display problems, and customize your viewing experience.

If you experience issues, revert to the recommended resolution or update your graphics drivers. With the steps above, you can confidently adjust your display without fear.

The purchase order, often referred to as a PO, is a powerful tool for controlling business expenses and improving financial transparency.

Thereâ€™s a lot to learn about the basics of using purchase orders. But donâ€™t worry â€” weâ€™ve compiled a complete guide to give you a 360-degree understanding of this topic.

In this article, you'll learn what a purchase order is, the information it should contain, its benefits, and how to implement a purchase order system step-by-step in your company.

Image: Example of purchase order process (source: Pexels)

What is a Purchase Order?

A purchase order is a commercial document sent by a buyer to a supplier to authorize a purchase. It's sometimes described as an "invoice in reverse" because it formalizes the buyerâ€™s intent to purchase specific goods or services.

Purchase orders typically include:

  • Product or service details
  • Quantities
  • Delivery dates
  • Payment terms

While not always considered contracts, they serve as a formal record of the buyer's commitment to pay and help minimize miscommunication.

Key Functions of a Purchase Order:

  1. Inventory Management: Helps track incoming goods or materials.
  2. Financial Control: Prevents unauthorized spending.
  3. Supplier Communication: Acts as a green light for the supplier to fulfill the order.

How Does a Purchase Order Work in a Company?

The standard information included in a purchase order includes:

  • Buyerâ€™s company name
  • Supplierâ€™s details (e.g. tax ID/CNPJ)
  • Date of order
  • Description and quantity of items or services
  • Agreed pricing
  • Payment terms (e.g., net 30)
  • Delivery address
  • Unique PO number

Many companies require suppliers to be pre-registered in the system. This may include submitting bank details or undergoing a credit check.

How to Create a Purchase Order

Creating a PO is straightforward. You can use a template or software to fill in the required information and send it via email or an internal system. Here's what to focus on:

1. Clear Expectations

A PO clearly defines product specifications, quantities, delivery expectations, and pricing. This minimizes misunderstandings and creates a formal trail if things go wrong.

2. Purchasing Management

POs streamline the work of purchasing and finance teams, allowing better tracking of what was ordered, from whom, and at what cost.

3. Financial Tracking

Each purchase is documented and tied to a PO number, making budgeting and invoice reconciliation much easier.

4. Legal Protection

In disputes or audits, purchase orders serve as evidence that both parties agreed on terms. They complement contracts and support compliance.

Limitations of Purchase Orders

Not all business expenses can be processed through purchase orders. For example:

  • Recurring bills: Utilities like electricity or rent.
  • Subscriptions: SaaS or magazine subscriptions billed monthly or annually.
  • Variable cost services: Legal or marketing services that donâ€™t have fixed prices upfront.
  • Internal expenses: Employee reimbursements or travel expenses.

How to Implement a Purchase Order System

1. Define a Purchasing Policy

Establish guidelines for how purchases should be requested, approved, and processed. This includes:

  • Supplier selection process
  • Minimum spend thresholds for POs
  • Ethical considerations
  • Negotiation protocols

2. Assign Roles and Responsibilities

A structured PO system requires role delegation. Common roles include:

  • Administrator: Manages system settings and permissions.
  • Approver: Authorized to approve purchases.
  • Finance: Reconciles invoices with POs.
  • Requester: Employees who create purchase requests.

3. Customize the PO Template

Most systems come with default PO templates. Add custom fields if needed, such as supplier ID, product codes, or internal budget references.

Remember: In many businesses, only pre-approved vendors can be issued POs, which adds a layer of compliance and risk control.

How to Fix Windows 10 Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) â€“ Complete Step-by-Step Troubleshooting Guide

The Blue Screen of Death, officially known as a stop error or bug check, is a critical system error screen displayed on Windows computers when the operating system encounters a problem it cannot recover from without risking data loss or hardware damage. This is often referred to as a blue screen error.

Itâ€™s called the â€œBlue Screen of Deathâ€ because of its distinctive blue background, although the design and layout have evolved across different Windows versions. Regardless of appearance, a BSOD always indicates a serious system-level issue that requires immediate attention.

In this detailed guide, youâ€™ll learn what causes BSOD errors, how to understand stop codes, and most importantly, how to fix Windows 10 blue screen errors step by stepâ€”even if your PC wonâ€™t boot normally.

  • 1. What Is the Blue Screen of Death?
  • 2. What Happens When a BSOD Occurs?

1. What Is the Blue Screen of Death?

A Blue Screen of Death occurs when Windows encounters a fatal error that forces the system to stop immediately. This prevents further damage to system files, hardware components, or user data.

Unlike regular crashes, BSOD errors operate at the kernel level, meaning they involve critical system processes or drivers.

Common stop codes you may see include:

  • CRITICAL_PROCESS_DIED
  • MEMORY_MANAGEMENT
  • IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL
  • PAGE_FAULT_IN_NONPAGED_AREA

Each stop code points to a specific category of failure.

2. What Happens When a BSOD Occurs?

When a BSOD occurs, Windows automatically creates a minidump file that stores information about the crash. This file helps technicians and advanced users diagnose the exact cause.

Key actions during a BSOD:

  • All running processes are stopped
  • Memory data is written to disk
  • A stop code is displayed on screen
  • The system restarts automatically

This emergency shutdown is a protective mechanism, not a failure of Windows.

3. Windows 10 Blue Screen Error Example

Fix Windows 10 Blue Screen Error (Step-by-Step)

4. Shut Down the PC That Showed the BSOD

If your system freezes after displaying the blue screen, press and hold the power button until the computer powers off.

This is safe because the system has already crashed, and no temporary data can be saved at this point.

Possible underlying causes include:

  • Hard disk corruption or failing storage media
  • BIOS or UEFI misconfiguration
  • Outdated or incompatible Windows versions

5. Common Causes of Windows 10 BSOD

Understanding what triggers BSOD errors makes fixing them much easier.

  • Faulty or outdated drivers
  • Corrupted Windows system files
  • Defective RAM modules
  • Failing HDD or SSD
  • Malware infections
  • Overclocking or overheating

Most blue screen errors stem from software-level problems, not hardware failure.

6. Disconnect All USB Devices Except Mouse and Keyboard

External devices and their drivers are common BSOD triggers.

  • Disconnect printers, scanners, USB drives, and webcams
  • Restart your PC
  • Reconnect devices one at a time

If the error disappears, youâ€™ve identified the faulty device or driver.

7. Start Your PC in Safe Mode

Safe Mode loads Windows with minimal drivers and services, making it ideal for troubleshooting.

  • Force shutdown during boot three times
  • Select Advanced Options
  • Go to Troubleshoot â†’ Startup Settings
  • Press F4 to enter Safe Mode

From Safe Mode, you can uninstall problematic software or drivers.

8. Check Device Manager for Driver Problems

  • Right-click Start â†’ Device Manager
  • Look for yellow warning icons (!)
  • Right-click the device â†’ Update driver

If updating fails, try disabling or uninstalling the device.

9. Check for Sufficient Free Disk Space

Windows requires adequate free space to function properly.

  • Open This PC
  • Ensure at least 10â€“15% free space
  • Run Disk Cleanup

Low disk space can directly cause system crashes.

10. Install the Latest Windows Updates

Microsoft frequently releases fixes for BSOD-related bugs.

  • Start â†’ Settings â†’ Windows Update
  • Select Check for updates
  • Install all available updates

11. System Restore

If nothing else helps, restoring Windows to a previous state may resolve the issue.

Hold the F8 key during startup and select Repair Computer. From there, choose System Restore.

This process does not remove personal files.

12. Access Troubleshooting Tools

  1. Open Windows Settings
  2. Navigate to Update & Security
  3. Select Troubleshoot â†’ Additional troubleshooters
  4. Choose Blue Screen
  5. Run as administrator

Ensure Windows is fully updated before running diagnostics.

13. Tips to Help You Fix and Prevent BSOD Errors

  1. Note your BSOD stop code
  2. Keep drivers updated
  3. Scan for malware regularly
  4. Monitor system temperatures
  5. Avoid unstable overclocking

Final Thoughts

The Windows 10 Blue Screen of Death may look alarming, but itâ€™s often fixable with proper troubleshooting. By following these steps, you can identify the root cause, fix system crashes, and restore your PCâ€™s stability.

Regular updates, proper maintenance, and cautious hardware changes will help ensure you never see that blue screen again.

No â€” as long as your village is connected to Supercell ID, Google Play, or Game Center. If not, back up your player tag and link before clearing data.

Try clearing cache, force stopping, or reinstalling. If many players report the same issue, wait for Supercell's fix â€” they may roll a hotfix or server patch.

First tests show that the computer can only start Windows 8 in Safe Mode. Any other attempt results in failure followed by an automatic restart. Pressing the power button during restart only speeds up this frustrating â€œcycle of no hope.â€ Although Safe Mode offers Automatic Startup Repair, it ends with the message â€œStartup Repair couldnâ€™t repair your PC.â€ Fortunately, disk checks confirm that user data remains intact.

Repeated attempts to repair the Windows Boot Manager or Master Boot Record (MBR) often fail due to permission issues, missing tools, or incorrect guidance found across community forums. Clean Up Disk Space 6. Delete Temporary Files 7. Update Graphics Drivers 8. Disable Unnecessary Startup Programs 9. Scan for Malware and Spyware 10. Check BIOS & Boot Configuration 11. System Restore or Windows Reinstallation 12. Why Windows 10 Boots Slowly After Updates 13. Final Optimization Tips ---

1. What Causes Windows 10 Slow Boot?

A slow Windows 10 startup is usually caused by a combination of software conflicts, outdated drivers, storage limitations, and system configuration issues. Over time, as applications accumulate and updates pile up, Windows struggles to load efficiently.

Common reasons include:

  • Running Windows on a traditional HDD
  • Corrupted system or boot files
  • Too many startup programs
  • Low free disk space
  • Outdated graphics drivers
  • Malware or spyware infections
---

2. Windows Boot Loop & Startup Repair Failure Explained

A boot loop occurs when Windows repeatedly restarts without reaching the desktop. This often happens after a failed update, corrupted system file, or improper shutdown. Windows attempts Automatic Startup Repair, but when critical system components are damaged, the repair tool fails.

Although alarming, this does not always mean data loss. In most cases, files remain safe, and the issue can be resolved through systematic troubleshooting.

---

3. Basic Fixes to Try First

Before jumping into advanced solutions, try these quick checks:

  • Disconnect all external devices (USB drives, printers)
  • Boot into Safe Mode and restart normally
  • Ensure your system clock and BIOS time are correct
  • Check for pending Windows updates

Sometimes, a simple reboot after Safe Mode resets stuck background services.

---

4. Upgrade to an SSD (or Consider a New PC)

One of the biggest causes of slow Windows boot time is running the operating system on a traditional hard disk drive (HDD). HDDs are affordable but painfully slow for modern operating systems.

SSD vs HDD â€“ Which One Should You Choose?

Benefits of upgrading to an SSD:

  • Boot time reduced from minutes to seconds
  • Faster app launches
  • Improved overall system responsiveness

If your PC is very old, investing in a new system may be more cost-effective.

---

5. Clean Up Your Disk Space

Low disk space significantly slows down Windows startup. When Windows lacks room for temporary files and caching, boot performance suffers.

How to use Disk Cleanup:

  • Open File Explorer
  • Right-click on the C: drive
  • Select Properties â†’ Disk Cleanup
  • Check temporary files, recycle bin, update files
  • Click Clean up system files for deeper cleanup

This process alone can free several gigabytes of space.

---

6. Delete Temporary Files Manually

Temporary files stored in the %temp% folder accumulate quickly and slow down Windows boot.

Steps to remove temp files:

  • Press Windows + R
  • Type %temp% and press Enter
  • Select all files
  • Right-click â†’ Delete

Skip files that are currently in use. This cleanup improves startup speed and stability.

---

7. Update Graphics Drivers

Outdated or incompatible graphics drivers often cause slow boot, black screens, or system freezes after login.

To update graphics drivers:

  • Right-click Start â†’ Device Manager
  • Expand Display adapters
  • Right-click your GPU â†’ Update driver
  • Select Search automatically for drivers

Keeping drivers updated ensures smooth boot transitions and better performance.

---

8. Disable Unnecessary Startup Programs

Too many apps launching at startup can dramatically slow Windows boot time.

How to disable startup apps:

  • Press Ctrl + Shift + Esc
  • Go to the Startup tab
  • Disable apps with High startup impact

Only keep essential services enabled.

---

9. Scan for Malware and Spyware

Malware infections often run hidden processes during boot, increasing startup time.

Use:

  • Windows Defender (Full Scan)
  • Malwarebytes (Free version)

Remove any detected threats and reboot.

---

10. Check BIOS & Boot Configuration

Incorrect BIOS settings can also cause slow startup.

  • Enable Fast Boot
  • Ensure correct boot drive priority
  • Disable unused boot devices

Access BIOS by pressing DEL, F2, or F12 during startup.

---

11. Restore or Reinstall Windows

If nothing works, consider:

  • System Restore (without data loss)
  • Reset this PC (Keep my files)
  • Clean Windows installation

These options fix deeply corrupted system files.

---

12. Why Windows 10 Slow Boot After Update?

Common causes include:

  • Driver incompatibility
  • Corrupted update files
  • Background indexing
  • Startup service conflicts

Updates temporarily increase boot time but persistent issues indicate deeper problems.

---

13. Final Optimization Tips

  • Keep at least 20% disk space free
  • Use SSD for OS
  • Update Windows regularly
  • Avoid third-party boot managers

By following this guide, you can significantly reduce Windows 10 boot time, fix startup repair failures, and restore system performance without losing data.

entry.title: Points of Attention in the Financial Management of Small
entry.content:
Service providers, as they do not sell products, have different dynamics to other businesses and require special care with Financial Management.



To avoid the risk of breaking even and actually making a profit, you must first be able to answer the following questions:

  • What is your companyâ€™s average monthly revenue?
  • What is the cost of providing your service?
  • What are the fixed costs and variable expenses for the month?
  • What periods of the year are there increases or decreases in revenue?

Answering these questions is the first step toward dealing effectively with the finances of your company. Below, you will find the key points for attention and the tips on handling service company finances.

The importance of financial management for service companies

Good financial management includes planning, analysis and control of activities related to investment, expenses, profits, financing, loans and the equity value of the business.

Since the focus is not on sales, but on solving the clientâ€™s problems, the service provider company needs to have its financial management adapted, without losing the objectives common to all types of businesses:

  • help the business grow;
  • identify bottlenecks and future challenges;
  • analyze financial performance;
  • assess deviations from financial indicators, comparing what was predicted with what was actually achieved;
  • implement corrective measures;
  • control the payment and receipt of bills.

Points of attention for efficient financial management

Check out our tips on good practices to adopt in the financial management of your service company:

Check the costs

The first step is to know all of your companyâ€™s costs, including fixed, variable and service costs:

â€¢  Fixed costs : these are related to the companyâ€™s operations, such as rent, internet, salaries, among others;

â€¢  Variable costs : these are values â€‹â€‹that can increase or decrease according to the services provided, such as maintenance of your equipment, payment to suppliers, commissions, taxes, or any cost that starts to exist from the moment there is work;

â€¢  Service costs : these are specific to carrying out the work, such as transportation for employees, materials used by them and hours worked.

Reduce costs

It is recommended to map out costs in order to identify what can be cut, reduced and optimized. Regarding fixed costs, it is possible to adopt conscious consumption to avoid wasting water and electricity, for example. Regarding variable costs, you can negotiate with suppliers and review commissions. In addition, it is necessary to carry out good tax planning in order to pay less taxes in accordance with tax avoidance practices.

After all, the best strategies are those that increase your profit margin.

Apply prices appropriately

Knowing how to set prices is often more complex for companies that provide services. It is necessary to analyze the total value of the services, which includes fixed, variable and service costs. It is also essential to know the average value applied in the market so as not to price your service inappropriately, above or below this value.

Control cash flow

For good financial management, it is essential to control income and expenses, as well as to project future earnings and expenses. Both credit and cash sales, loan installments, investment redemptions and payments made to suppliers must be taken into account. Therefore, cash flow must be updated daily to avoid inconsistencies.

Control working capital

Working capital is what keeps the company operating. Thus, in order to compute it, the following values must be known:

  • Current assets : include accounts receivable, advances, redemptions and other amounts;
  • Current liabilities : include payroll, accounts payable and taxes.

Now, calculate current assets minus current liabilities. The longer your payment term to customers, the higher your working capital should be.

Define performance indicators (KPIs)

The best way to analyze your financial management is by defining KPIs, key performance indicators, according to the reality of your company. The most commonly used indicators for service providers are those that demonstrate current liquidity, profitability and return.

entry.title: What is a LUT? How to Use & Create LUT Filters for Video (Desktop + Mobile)
entry.content:
Color grading can completely transform a video. A LUT (Look-Up Table) is a simple, portable way to apply a color grade across clips and apps â€” from Davinci Resolve to the VN mobile editor.

Contents
  1. What is a LUT?
  2. Why use LUTs?
  3. How to create LUTs (Premiere, Resolve, Final Cut)
  4. Use LUTs on mobile (VN, Premiere Rush, Filmora)
  5. How to import LUT into VN â€” step-by-step
  6. Tips & best practices

What is a LUT?

LUT stands for Look-Up Table. In video and photo editing, itâ€™s a small file that maps input colors to new output colors â€” essentially a preset for color grading. Instead of redoing the same adjustments every time (contrast, gamma, hue shifts, etc.), you apply a LUT and the exact color transform is applied to each pixel.

Think of a LUT like a reusable color filter: create the look once, save it, and apply it across projects and apps.

Why use LUTs?

  • Speed: Apply a polished grade in one click.
  • Consistency: Keep the same look across scenes and cameras.
  • Portability: Share the same grade between DaVinci Resolve, Premiere Pro, Final Cut, and supported mobile apps.
  • Learning: Analyze professional LUTs to see how colors and contrast are shaped.

How to create LUTs (Desktop â€” Premiere, Resolve, Final Cut)

Professional editing apps let you build a grade, then export that grade as a LUT file (commonly .cube or .3dl). The workflow is similar across programs:

  1. Open your software and load a representative clip or a color chart.
  2. Apply color corrections and creative adjustments (lift/gamma/gain, curves, color wheels, saturation).
  3. Once satisfied, locate the export function: Export LUT or Generate 3D LUT.
  4. Save the file (.cube is widely supported).

Quick notes for each app

  • DaVinci Resolve: Color page > right-click node > Generate 3D LUT.
  • Adobe Premiere Pro: Lumetri panel > three-dot menu > Export .cube.
  • Final Cut Pro: Use color board/curves and third-party plugins to export LUTs (or use Compressor workflows).

Can you use LUTs on mobile phones?

Yes. Many mobile editors support LUT files â€” either directly or via import tools. Popular mobile apps that support LUTs include:

  • VN - Video Editor (import .cube files)
  • Adobe Premiere Rush (limited support; use mobile-friendly LUT presets or sync from Premiere Pro)
  • Filmr / FilmoraGo (import presets and LUT packs)
  • InShot / KineMaster (support via plugins or pro versions)
  • Node Video (powerful mobile editor with LUT support)

How to import and use a LUT in VN â€” step-by-step

  1. Download the LUT (.cube or .lut) to your phone.
  2. Option A â€” File manager: Locate the LUT file in your file manager, tap Share > choose VN (if the option appears) to import.
  3. Option B â€” From VN: Open VN, load a project, open Filter > tap the + icon > Import from file > locate and select your LUT file.
  4. Apply the LUT to your clip and fine-tune intensity, exposure, and saturation inside VN to match the footage.

DOWNLOAD

If VN shows many built-in filters, your imported LUT will appear among the custom or user filters â€” name them clearly so you can reuse them.

Troubleshooting

  • If the LUT looks too strong, reduce strength or lower contrast in your base exposure.
  • Some LUTs are designed for log footage â€” if your footage is not log, apply a corrective LUT or adjust exposure/contrast first.
  • Make sure the LUT file format is supported (.cube is safest).

Tips & best practices

  • Always balance exposure first: Basic correction before applying a LUT prevents clipping and weird color shifts.
  • Use 3D LUTs for creative looks: They handle complex color transforms better than simple 1D LUTs.
  • Keep a library: Name and organize LUTs by style (cinematic, warm, teal-orange, moody) for quick access.
  • Test across devices: A LUT that looks great on a phone may need tweaks for TV or web playback.

  • A short video tutorial showing the VN import steps.
  • An AMP-ready HTML article or a 600-word mobile summary.

Aside from other things that are going to be of importance and must be planned well in advance, you should be prepared to plan growth objectives, market forecasts, campaigns, or marketing strategies in order to be able to act accordingly to the response from an increasingly demanding market.

3. Create a Budget

The financial plan you draw up should naturally be translated into a budget, which is essentially a structured way of organising money. In this way, the company will control the finances and not the other way around; it can monitor and try to reduce regular expenses and extraordinary expenses. This budget is supposed to be changed periodically, so it has to be reviewed regularly during the month, quarterly, and annually.

4. Separate personal finances from business finances

The ability to manage personal finances efficiently is an extremely important skill for a manager. If you know how to set personal financial goals, create and manage a budget, monitor investments, and handle credit cards and debts responsibly, you just need to replicate the same in your business!

However, entrepreneurs often mix personal income and expenses with those of the company, which can become complicated in terms of financial organization and assets. Therefore, a good practice is to keep separate bank accounts, establish fair salaries and focus on the companyâ€™s growth.

5. Track Cash Flow

The proper monitoring of cash flow solely determines the survival and growth of a company. Therefore, cash inflows and outflows should be monitored daily, financial forecasts prepared, and resources optimally utilized without compromising profitability.

These reporting automation tools could be great assistants in understanding your company results more thoroughly, since they collect information and data more effectively. Avoid having financial problems at the end of the day or month, because this would make the survival of your company unviable!

6. Be aware of unnecessary expenses and reduce costs

Growing internally and expanding your business is every entrepreneurâ€™s dream, but you need to be aware of all costs and limit your expenses to what is strictly necessary. Avoid spending more than is really justified for the current situation. For example, hiring new employees or moving to a larger space are costs that must be carefully considered to avoid financial ruin.

On the other hand, it is important to reduce expenses whenever possible, namely through a cost reduction plan:

  1. Analyze what each area of â€‹â€‹the business contributes to the companyâ€™s profit;
  2. Find out the expenses of each sector of the business;
  3. Compare profit with cost in each area;
  4. Create a cost reduction plan for each sector of the business;
  5. Monitor and make necessary adjustments.

Allocating funds to each department is crucial for efficient financial management. A specific budget should be allocated to each department, such as customer service and support, marketing, sales and purchasing, and every effort should be made to avoid confusion or changes in funds between departments. This makes it easier to hold each department accountable for its expenses and better understand where costs can be cut.

7. Manage assets and create reserves

Managing the assets properly is a must for any firm since that would prevent them from being squandered, minimize losses, and make it easier to buy. In addition, control over the assets means management of all the existing tangible assets, including real estate, money, stock, investments, etc., as well as those that are intangible, like company or brand value, copyright, licenses, etc. Assessment of the assets informs of the real and current value of all assets the company has and gives a possibility to calculate the general value of them.

It is in times of crisis and â€˜shocksâ€™ that one realizes the value of financial reserves. Hence, setting up financial reserves for off-season sales or economic shocks beyond any companyâ€™s anticipation is very critical. This way, with an available reserve, strategies can be adopted to prevent financial blows to the company or even dismissing employees.

Another important financial reserve is to set aside part of the profits for future investments in areas that will help the business grow. This could be a decisive factor in relation to the competition!

8. Control stock

Stock management is essential for companies that sell physical products, as it has a direct impact on profits. A cloud-based management system allows you to view the quantity of each item in stock and predict seasonal demand. This way, you can ensure that the right amount of stock is available whenever needed, avoiding wasting money.

9. Pay taxes on time

Meeting tax payment deadlines requires some organization, but in the long run, it saves time and money, as you only pay what is due, without fines or interest.

If you have difficulty making your monthly tax payments, separate the amounts monthly. This way, you will treat this expense as a monthly operating cost and will have no difficulty paying it on time.

10. Hire smartly

Effective financial management does not mean that you have to hire employees at low cost or have fewer workers. Paying less than the benchmark value can drive away good professionals and hiring fewer employees can overburden existing ones, which increases unwanted turnover in the company.

So, what you need to do is hire wisely and intelligently. Research the market for salaries for the position you need, set a salary for the role, list all the technical and soft skills you want, and conduct assertive interviews.

11. Invest in automation

Donâ€™t fear automation, most especially if you think it may be too expensive for your business. There are equipment that are really expensive to buy, but in the long run, it could help save you money due to its efficiency. Of course, you need to carefully assess if thereâ€™s a need for certain equipment before buying. Identify carefully the sectors that could benefit from machines and automation.

These are the main advantages of using automation in your company:

  • helps improve efficiency;
  • increases productivity;
  • reduces costs;
  • maintains consistency in processes;
  • creates time for strategic and creative tasks.

12. Use Online Invoicing Software

In a world that is fast digitalizing, technologies allowing easiness in the management of business become more relevant to achieve positive results. Invoicing software provides the tool to make the financial management of a company easy by automating the processes, hence enhancing its efficiency.

How to Speed Up Windows 10 â€“ A Complete Step-by-Step Guide to Boost PC Performance

If your computer feels slow, freezes frequently, or takes too long to start, youâ€™re not alone. Many users experience performance issues over time, even on powerful machines. The good news is that you donâ€™t need to buy a new PC right away. With the right settings and maintenance, you can speed up Windows 10 and restore smooth performance.

This comprehensive guide will show you how to optimize Windows 10, reduce lag, and improve overall system responsiveness using safe and proven methods. Whether you use your PC for work, study, or casual browsing, these tips will help your system run faster and more efficiently.

1. Keep Windows 10 Updated

One of the easiest and most effective ways to boost Windows 10 performance is keeping your system up to date. Microsoft regularly releases updates that improve system stability, fix bugs, and enhance security.

Some updates also include improved drivers and performance optimizations that directly affect system speed.

How to check for updates:

  • Click the Start menu
  • Go to Settings â†’ Update & Security â†’ Windows Update

  • Install all available updates
  • Restart your PC

Tip: Enable automatic updates so your PC stays optimized without manual effort.

2. Disable Unnecessary Startup Programs

Many applications automatically start when Windows boots, slowing down startup time and consuming system resources.

Disabling unnecessary startup apps can significantly speed up a slow PC.

Steps to disable startup programs:

  • Press Ctrl + Shift + Esc to open Task Manager
  • Go to the Startup tab
  • Right-click unnecessary apps
  • Select Disable

Only keep essential programs like antivirus and system drivers enabled.

3. Run the Compatibility Troubleshooter

Older programs may not be optimized for Windows 10 and can cause performance issues. The built-in Compatibility Troubleshooter automatically fixes such problems.

How to run it:

  • Type Troubleshoot in the search box
  • Select Troubleshoot settings
  • Click Program Compatibility Troubleshooter

  • Follow on-screen instructions

This tool is especially helpful for older games and productivity software.

4. Disable Transparency & Visual Effects

Windows 10 includes several visual effects that look nice but consume system resources, especially on low-end PCs.

Disable Transparency Effects

  • Go to Settings â†’ Personalization â†’ Colors
  • Turn Transparency effects Off

Adjust Visual Effects for Best Performance

  • Search for Performance
  • Select Adjust the appearance and performance of Windows
  • Choose Adjust for best performance
  • Click Apply â†’ OK

This can noticeably reduce lag and improve responsiveness.

5. Clean Up Disk Space & Storage

Low disk space can severely slow down Windows 10. Temporary files, cache data, and unused apps accumulate over time.

Use Storage Sense

  • Go to Settings â†’ System â†’ Storage
  • Enable Storage Sense
  • Click Configure Storage Sense

Run Disk Cleanup

  • Search for Disk Cleanup
  • Select your system drive (C:)
  • Check temporary files
  • Click OK

Freeing up space improves system speed and stability.

6. Scan for Malware & Security Threats

Malware, spyware, and unwanted programs often run silently in the background, consuming CPU and memory.

Run a full scan using Windows Security:

  • Open Windows Security
  • Go to Virus & threat protection
  • Select Scan options
  • Choose Full scan

Extra protection: Tools like Malwarebytes can detect threats that Windows Defender may miss.

7. Change Power Plan for Better Performance

Windows often defaults to a balanced power plan that limits performance.

Enable High Performance mode:

  • Open Control Panel
  • Go to Power Options
  • Select High performance

This allows your CPU and GPU to run at full potential.

8. Update Drivers for Maximum Stability

Outdated drivers can cause crashes, lag, and poor performance.

Update drivers:

  • Open Device Manager
  • Right-click a device
  • Select Update driver

Focus on graphics, chipset, and network drivers for best results.

9. Limit Background Apps

Many apps run in the background even when youâ€™re not using them.

  • Go to Settings â†’ Privacy â†’ Background apps
  • Turn off unnecessary apps

This saves RAM and improves battery life.

10. Hardware Upgrades That Make a Huge Difference

11. Make PC Maintenance a Habit

  • Run monthly malware scans
  • Clean storage every few weeks
  • Install updates regularly

Consistency is the key to long-term performance.

Final Thoughts

By following this guide, you can speed up Windows 10, reduce lag, and enjoy a smoother computing experience without spending money unnecessarily. These safe and proven optimizations work for both old and new systems.

Make these steps part of your routine, and your PC will remain fast, stable, and reliable for years to come.

How to Sync Contacts from Gmail to iPhone

Quick, safe and AdSense-friendly guide to get your Google contacts onto your iPhone. Follow the method that fits your iOS version and privacy preferences.

Table of contents
  1. Reasons to sync Google contacts to iPhone
  2. Method 1 â€” Add Google account (recommended)
  3. Method 2 â€” Export & import (vCard)
  4. Troubleshooting & tips
  5. Privacy notes

Reasons to transfer your Google contacts to iPhone

  • Keep a single, central contact list across devices and accounts.
  • Merge duplicate entries and consolidate email, phone, and profile data.
  • Make switching away from Gmail easierâ€”your contacts stay accessible.
  • Back up important contacts to Apple iCloud or a local file for redundancy.

Method 1 â€” Add your Google account to iPhone (fast, keeps contacts synced)

Best for: Ongoing syncing between Gmail/Google Contacts and iPhone Contacts app.

  1. Open Settings on your iPhone.
  2. Tap Mail (or Mail, Contacts, Calendars on older iOS versions) > Add Account.
  3. Choose Google and sign in with your Gmail account credentials.
  4. When the account options appear, toggle Contacts to On, then tap Save.
  5. Open the Contacts app and pull down to refresh; your Google contacts will begin to appear. Sync frequency depends on account settings and network connectivity.

Notes

  • If you already have the Google account added, go to Settings > Mail > Accounts > your Google account and enable Contacts.
  • Contacts synced this way stay linked to the Google account; deleting the account removes those contacts from the iPhone unless they are merged or copied to iCloud.

Method 2 â€” Export Google Contacts as vCard and import to iPhone (one-time copy)

Best for: One-time migration or if you prefer not to keep an account linked.

  1. On a computer, open Google Contacts.
  2. Select the contacts you want (or Export > Contacts to export all) and choose the vCard (for iOS Contacts) format.
  3. Save the .vcf file to your computer.
  4. Email the .vcf file to an account you can access on the iPhone, or upload it to iCloud Drive.
  5. Open the .vcf file on the iPhone â€” tap it from Mail or Files â€” and choose Add All Contacts to import into the iPhone Contacts app.

Notes

  • This method creates a local copy of contacts on the iPhone; it does not keep them synced with Google.
  • If you want to merge imported contacts with iCloud, enable Contacts in Settings > [your name] > iCloud before importing.

Troubleshooting & tips

  • No contacts showed up? Go to Settings > Contacts > Accounts > your Google account and verify Contacts is enabled.
  • Duplicates: Use the Contacts app's Contacts view to find and merge duplicates, or manage duplicates in Google Contacts.
  • Sync delays: A manual refresh (open Contacts and pull down) often forces a sync; ensure you have a stable internet connection.
  • iCloud vs Google: If you plan to use iCloud as your primary source, consider copying Google contacts to iCloud for faster native push updates.

Privacy notes

Connecting your Google account to an iPhone shares contact data between the services. If you disconnect the Google account later, contacts tied only to that account will be removed from the device unless copied to iCloud or exported first.
